接.definition: to receive; to answer (the phone); to meet or welcome sb; to connect; to catch; to join; to extend; to take one's turn on duty; to take over for sb

接上.definition: to connect (a cable etc); to hook up (a device); to resume (a conversation); to set (a bone)

接下來.definition: to accept; to take; next; following

接二連三.definition: (idiom) one after another; in quick succession

接任.definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)

接住.definition: to catch (sth thrown etc); to receive (sth given); to accept

接入.definition: to access (a network); to insert (a plug) into (a socket)

接力棒.definition: relay baton; (fig.) responsibilities (passed over to one's successor)

接受.definition: to accept (a suggestion, punishment, bribe etc); to acquiesce

接合.definition: to connect; to join; to assemble

接單.definition: to take a customer's order; (of a taxi driver) to accept a booking; (of a delivery rider) to accept a delivery job

接地氣.definition: in touch with the common people; down-to-earth

接客.definition: to receive guests; to receive patrons (of prostitutes)

接引.definition: to greet and usher in (guests, newcomers etc); (Buddhism) to receive into the Pure Land

接待.definition: to receive; to entertain; to host (guests, visitors or clients)

接應.definition: to provide support; to come to the rescue

接手.definition: to take over (duties etc); catcher (baseball etc)

接掌.definition: to take over; to take control

接收.definition: reception (of transmitted signal); to receive; to accept; to admit; to take over (e.g. a factory); to expropriate

接替.definition: to replace; to take over (a position or post)

接案.definition: to be informed of a case; to take a case; to contract for a job (as a freelancer)

接機.definition: to meet (or pick up) sb arriving by plane; (of airport staff) to deal with the arrival of a plane

接活.definition: to take on a piece of work; to pick up some freelance work; (of a taxi driver) to pick up a fare

接洽.definition: to discuss a matter with sb; to get in touch with; to arrange

接班.definition: to take over (from those working the previous shift); to take over (in a leadership role etc); to succeed sb

接球.definition: to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc); to catch a ball thrown by sb

接盤.definition: (of an entrepreneur) to buy up a struggling business; (finance) to snap up shares sold off by others; (neologism) (slang) to take as a girlfriend a woman who was dumped by her ex for sleeping around

接種.definition: to be vaccinated; to be inoculated

接穗.definition: scion (branch or bud that is grafted onto rootstock)

接管.definition: to take over; to assume control

接茬.definition: (coll.) to respond; to offer a comment; to jump into the conversation

接著.definition: to catch and hold on; to continue; to go on to do sth; to follow; to carry on; then; after that; subsequently; to proceed; to ensue; in turn; in one's turn

接見.definition: to receive sb; to grant an interview

接觸.definition: to touch; to contact; access; in touch with

接警.definition: (of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident

接踵而來.definition: to come one after the other

接軌.definition: railtrack connection; to integrate into sth; to dock; to connect; to be in step with; to bring into line with; to align

接近.definition: to approach; to get close to

接送.definition: to pick up and drop off; to ferry back and forth

接連.definition: on end; in a row; in succession

接頭.definition: connector; joint; coupling; (coll.) to contact; to get in touch with; to have knowledge of; to be familiar with

接風.definition: to hold a welcoming dinner or reception

接駁.definition: to access; to transfer passengers between two railway lines

接駁車.definition: shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines

接龍.definition: to build up a sequence; a succession of things, each linked to the previous one
